btbr

Currently in heavy development.

Getting Started

The goal of {btbr} is to provide a repository for the workflows and code used to create the Bull Trout Baseline in Western Montana per USDA Forest Service. This workflow currently uses statistical methods which are use in a Bayesian Network framework. Please use the Vignettes dropdown to navigate to the Final Integrated Risk, Sediment Indicator and Stream Temperature Indicator documentation and workflows. These Vignettes show how the indicators were developed as well as implemented into the Bayesian Network.

The final integrated risk is determined by developing probabilities associated with each indicator and then used in the Baysian Network.

Or, if you have access to USDA internal network you can access via this path T:\FS\NFS\R01\Program\2500WatershedAirMgmt\GIS\WorkSpace\jerickson\Spatial\btb\btb.gdb

For contributing or submitting issues please go to Github to help.

Final Integrated Risk

This is a preliminary output accomplished by using the workflows within the vignettes. This is likely to change and is mostly for proof of concept.
